children.name: event
children.definition: sth that happens, especially something that is important or interesting: sự kiện
examples: one of the most important events in the history of mankind

children.name: a big/major event
children.definition: important
examples: Getting married is a major event in anyone’s life.

children.name: an important/significant event
examples: It’s natural to be nervous before such an important event.

children.name: a momentous event
children.definition: very important
examples: the momentous events of 9/11

children.name: a historic event
children.definition: very important in a country’s history
examples: The signing of the peace treaty was a historic event.

children.name: a dramatic event
children.definition: very exciting
examples: The dramatic events will be brought to you live on BBC.

children.name: a tragic event
children.definition: very sad
examples: Let’s not talk about the tragic events of the past.

children.name: a traumatic event
children.definition: very upsetting
examples: He was forced to relive the traumatic events of his kidnap.

children.name: a common/an everyday event
examples: The death of a child was a common event in those days.

children.name: a rare/unusual event
examples: A sighting of a white deer is a rare event.

children.name: recent events
examples: Recent events in the country have caused great concern.

children.name: the latest events
examples: We will be bringing you news of all the latest events.

children.name: current events
examples: There are some similarities between what happened in the 1920s and current events in the US.

children.name: an event happens/takes place
children.definition: alsoan event occursformal
examples: The event took place last year.

children.name: events unfold
children.definition: happen, usually in an exciting or unexpected way
examples: I watched the dramatic events unfold from my window.

children.name: events lead
children.definition: up
examples: to something(= cause something )His assassination was one of the events that led to the First World War.

children.name: the events surrounding something
children.definition: the events that are closely related to a situation
examples: The events surrounding her death remain a mystery.

children.name: celebrate/commemorate/mark an event
children.definition: do something to show that you remember it
examples: Fans observed a minute’s silence to commemorate the tragic event.

children.name: witness an event
children.definition: see it happen
examples: Luckily, a film crew were on the spot to witness the event.

children.name: record an event
children.definition: write down or photograph what happened
examples: Two photographers recorded the events.

children.name: a series/sequence of events
children.definition: related events that happen one after the other
examples: The incident was the first in a series of events that finally led to his arrest.

children.name: a chain of events
children.definition: a series of events where each one causes the next
examples: He set in motion a chain of events that he couldn’t control.

children.name: the course of events
children.definition: the way in which a series of events happens
examples: Nothing you could have done would have changed the course of events.

children.name: thing
children.definition: informalsththat happens:việc, điều gì
examples: So many things have happened since I last saw you.

children.name: a funny thing happened
examples: A funny thing happened to me on the way to work this morning.

children.name: not remember a thingused to emphasize that you do not remember what happened
examples: When I woke up the next morning, I couldn’t remember a thing.

children.name: occurrence
children.definition: formalsththat happens – used especially when saying how oftensthhappens :sự kiện, sự việc
examples: Divorce is a common occurrence these days.
Storms like this one are fortunately a rare occurrence.
Accidents are almost a daily occurrence on this road.

children.name: frequent/rare/common occurrence
examples: Laughter was a rare occurrence in his classroom.
Flooding in the area is a common occurrence.

children.name: incident
children.definition: sththat happens, especiallysththat is unusual or unpleasant, orsththat is one of several events :sự việc
examples: He died after a violent incident outside a nightclub.
This latest incident could put an end to his career.
Am I at risk because of some incident in my sexual past?
Roads were sealed off because of a major incident.

children.name: a serious incident
examples: The road is closed following a serious incident earlier today.

children.name: a major incident
children.definition: very serious
examples: The most recent major incident was an explosion at an oil refinery.

children.name: a small/minor incident
examples: An apparently minor incident sparked off rioting.

children.name: the whole incident
examples: The whole incident was caught on CCTV.

children.name: a separate incident
examples: Young men were killed in two separate incidents on the same day.

children.name: a related incident
children.definition: connected to another incident
examples: The report describes a number of related incidents.

children.name: an isolated incident
children.definition: one that happens on its own, not together with others
examples: Luckily the attack turned out to be an isolated incident.

children.name: the latest incident
children.definition: the most recent one
examples: In the latest incident a post office was broken into.

children.name: a dramatic incident
children.definition: unexpected and exciting
examples: Viewers watched the dramatic incident on the television news.

children.name: a violent incident
examples: There have been several violent incidents at football matches recently.

children.name: a tragic incident
children.definition: one that involves someone’s death
examples: Andrew’s father was lost at sea in this tragic incident.

children.name: an unfortunate incident
children.definition: involving an accident or argument
examples: Disciplinary action may be taken over this unfortunate incident.

children.name: an embarrassing incident
examples: He left after an embarrassing incident in the bar.

children.name: a strange/unusual incident
examples: Any unusual incidents should be reported to the police.

children.name: a shooting/stabbing incident
children.definition: when someone is shot or stabbed
examples: Two men died today in a shooting incident.

children.name: an incident happens
examples: The incident happened as Mrs Edwards was walking her dog.

children.name: an incident occursformal
examples: The tragic incident occurred just after midnight.

children.name: cause an incident
examples: His carelessness caused a major incident.

children.name: provoke/spark off an incident
children.definition: cause it to happen suddenly
examples: It is claimed that the police provoked the incident.

children.name: be involved in an incident
examples: All those involved in the incident were sacked.

children.name: deal with/handle an incident
examples: The police were criticized for the way in which they handled the incident.

children.name: describe an incident
examples: Police asked the victim to describe the incident.

children.name: without incident
examples: The plane landed without incident.
Register Incidentis used mainly in journalism or in formal contexts. In everyday English, people usually saysthhappenedrather than talking aboutan incident:
Am I at risk because ofsomething that happenedin my past?

children.name: happening
children.definition: sththat happens, especiallysththat is strange or unusual: biến cố
examples: The happenings of the last two days had left me feeling dazed.
‘The X Files’ is a fictional television programme about strange, unexplained happenings.

children.name: strange/unusual/mysterious etc happenings
examples: There have been reports of strange happenings in the town.

children.name: phenomenon
children.definition: sththat happens or exists in society, science, or nature, especially something that is studied because it is difficult to understand: hiện tượng
examples: phenomenon of
the growing phenomenon of telecommuting
Homelessness is not anew phenomenon.
natural/historical/social etc phenomenon
Language is a social and cultural phenomenon.

children.name: a new phenomenon
examples: The idea that we may be able to live forever is is not a new phenomenon.

children.name: a recent phenomenon
examples: Detailed food labelling is a fairly recent phenomenon.

children.name: a common phenomenon
examples: Cloudy water is a common phenomenon in new aquariums.

children.name: a rare phenomenon
examples: Planes have occasionally disappeared in midair, but this is a rare phenomenon.

children.name: a strange phenomenon
examples: What could explain this strange phenomenon?

children.name: a natural phenomenon
children.definition: one that happens in nature
examples: Natural phenomena such as the appearance of comets intrigued him.

children.name: a social/cultural etc phenomenon
examples: Crime is a complex social phenomenon.

children.name: supernatural/paranormal phenomena
children.definition: ones that appear to be against the laws of nature
examples: Ghosts are one example of paranormal phenomena.

children.name: psychic phenomena
children.definition: relating to the power of the human mind to do strange things
examples: psychic phenomena such as telepathy

children.name: event
children.definition: a performance, sports competition, party etc at which people gather together to watch or take part insth:sự kiện
examples: Joe’s party was a splendid event - about 200 people were there.
a cultural/musical eventa monthly guide to the cultural events in London
annual eventan event that takes place every year
The town’s beer festival is an annual event.
a golfing/media/diplomatic etc event
The Ryder Cup is the big golfing event this month.

children.name: a social event
children.definition: an event at which a group of people meet and spend time together for pleasure
examples: I don’t go to many social events since my husband’s death.

children.name: a sporting event
examples: Many of the weekend’s major sporting events were cancelled due to bad weather.

children.name: a charity/fund-raising event
examples: Forthcoming fund-raising events include a sponsored five-mile walk.

children.name: hold/stage an event
children.definition: organize a public event
examples: The charity plans to stage several fund-raising events this year.

children.name: go to an event
children.definition: alsoattend an eventformal
examples: Unfortunately, the prime minister will not be able to attend the event.

children.name: support an event
children.definition: pay to attend a charity event in order to encourage it
examples: I’d like to thank everyone who came tonight for supporting the event.

children.name: boycott an event
children.definition: refuse to go to an event as a protest
examples: The games went ahead despite threats to boycott the event.

children.name: sponsor an event
children.definition: give money to an event, especially in exchange for the right to advertise
examples: The event is sponsored by the Royal Bank of Scotland.

children.name: occasion
children.definition: an important social event, ceremony, or celebration: dịp, lễ
examples: I’m saving this bottle of champagne for a special occasion.

children.name: a special occasion
examples: She used her best china on special occasions.

children.name: a big/great/splendid occasion
examples: The big occasion for country people was the Agricultural Fair.

children.name: a formal occasion
examples: He wore the suit on formal occasions.

children.name: a social occasion
examples: I prefer not to discuss business at social occasions.

children.name: a ceremonial occasion
children.definition: a very formal official occasion
examples: The gowns are worn only on ceremonial occasions.

children.name: a happy/joyful occasion
examples: The wedding had been a joyful occasion.

children.name: a sad/solemn occasion
examples: He did not want his funeral to be a sad and solemn occasion, but a celebration of his life.

children.name: a festive occasion
children.definition: when you celebrate something
examples: The Great Hall had been prepared for the festive occasion.

children.name: a historic occasion
children.definition: important as part of history
examples: This is truly a historic occasion.

children.name: celebrate an occasion
examples: To celebrate the occasion, a small party was held at his home.

children.name: mark an occasion
children.definition: do something special to celebrate an event
examples: The bells were rung to mark the occasion.

children.name: suit the occasion
examples: The table was decorated to suit the occasion.

children.name: a sense of occasion
children.definition: a feeling that an event is very special or important
examples: The music gave the event a real sense of occasion.

children.name: enter into the spirit of the occasion
children.definition: join in a social occasion in an eager way
examples: People entered into the spirit of the occasion by enjoying a picnic before the outdoor concert.

children.name: quite an occasiona very exciting or important occasion
examples: It was quite an occasion. All the local dignitaries were there, dressed in their finest clothes.

children.name: proceedings
children.definition: all the things which happen during an official meeting or discussion, especially in a court of law or in parliament:

children.name: the proceedings
examples: We watched the proceedings in the street below.
At this point in the proceedings, my doctor offered me a choice.

children.name: a series of bad things that happen at the same time
affair
children.definition: sththat happens, especiallysthunpleasant or shocking, that usually involves several people and several events:vụviệc, sự vụ
examples: The court case was an awful affair that dragged on for months.
The whole world was waiting for the outcome of the Watergate affair.
Nick Leeson had to serve a prison term in Singapore for his part in the affair.
The affair has caused people to lose confidence in their government.

children.name: business U
children.definition: business a set of connected events which you think are unpleasant, shocking, annoying etc: chuyện,vụviệc
examples: It was a nasty business. In the end, she killed herself, you know.

children.name: the whole business (ofsth)
examples: I don’t want to argue about this any more -- I’m sick of the whole business.
The whole business of getting a visa can take a very long time.

children.name: goings-on
children.definition: informal things that have been happening somewhere, especially ones that surprise, annoy, or amuse you:việc xảy ra, tình hình
examples: I could hardly believe it when he told me about the goings-on in his office.

children.name: strange/oddgoings-on
examples: According to Gwen, there had been some very strange goings-on in the upstairs apartment.
There've been a lot of strange/odd goings-on in that house recently.

children.name: scenes U
children.definition: scenes things that are happening at the same time in the same place involving a lot of people, all behaving in an angry, excited etc way:cảnh tượng
examples: Angry scenes in Parliament followed the minister’s statement.
The airport was full of the usual emotional scenes, and people saying ‘goodbye’.

children.name: turn of events
children.definition: a change in a situation: sự việc thay đổi, tình hình thay đổi
examples: an unexpected/strange/dramatic turn of events

children.name: history
children.definition: sththat has been done or experienced by a particular person or thing repeatedly over a long period: “lịch sử”

children.name: medical/employment/career etc history
examples: Your doctor will ask for your medical history.
He has a goodcredithistory (= a good record of paying money that he owes) .

children.name: history of
examples: There's a long historyofindustrial disputes at the factory.
Is there any history of heart disease in your family?
The defendanthad a history ofviolent assaults on women.
Her familyhas ahistoryofheart problems.

children.name: espisode
children.definition: episode a single event or group of related events: “hồi, đoạn”
examples: She decided she would try to forget the episode by the lake.
one of the most interesting episodes in his career.
This latest episode in the fraud scandal has shocked a lot of people.
The drugs, the divorce and the depression - it's an episode in his life that he wants to forget.

children.name: development
children.definition: a new event or piece of news that changes a situation :tiến triển

children.name: recentpoliticaldevelopmentsin the former Soviet Union
examples: We willkeepyouinformed of developments.

children.name: an important development in the fuel crisis
examples: Phone me if there are any new developments.

children.name: action
children.definition: nounACTIVITY
